centralQuestion: Should governments create a wealth tax?

reasons.description: A national wealth tax could generate significant new revenue—potentially well over $200 billion a year globally—providing funds for poverty reduction, climate action, and other public goods. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

sources.title: Reuters: Comment – Taxing the super‑rich is critical for our economies, the planet and closing the wealth gap

reasons.description: Supporters argue that a wealth tax would curb extreme wealth concentration, bolstering social cohesion and democratic stability—and even some ultra‑rich individuals say they would welcome it. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

sources.title: The Guardian: Labour shouldn’t fear taxing the rich – the people I work with would welcome it

reasons.description: Taxing net wealth directly can close loopholes that let large unrealised capital gains escape income taxation, making the overall tax code fairer and more efficient.

sources.title: Brookings Institution: Taxing the wealthy in fair and efficient ways

reasons.description: International evidence (e.g., Switzerland and Norway) shows that a well‑designed wealth tax is administratively feasible, raises meaningful revenue, and does not automatically trigger mass capital flight.

sources.title: Financial Times: Trade and wealth tax myth‑busting

objections.description: Valuing illiquid assets, policing evasion, and litigating disputes could make a wealth tax costly to administer and erode expected revenues. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

sources.title: Tax Policy Center: Taxing Wealth in the United States – Issues and Challenges

objections.description: Higher net‑worth levies may prompt wealthy residents to relocate, reducing the domestic tax base—as early UK experience after scrapping ‘non‑dom’ perks suggests. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

sources.title: Reuters: UK is now risky lab rat for rich tax‑perk reform

objections.description: Tech investors warn that taxing unrealised gains or large fortunes could sap liquidity needed for high‑risk innovation and slow the start‑up ecosystem. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

sources.title: Financial Times: Silicon Valley’s elite rattled by prospect of tax on unrealised gains

objections.description: Critics contend that a federal wealth tax could be struck down as an unapportioned direct tax under the U.S. Constitution, creating significant legal risk.

sources.title: Politico: Biden decides to shelve Warren’s wealth tax

research.title: Taxing Our Wealth
research.description: Scheuer & Slemrod (Journal of Economic Perspectives, 2021) review international experience and design options, finding behavioral responses depend heavily on base breadth and enforcement.

research.title: Wealth Taxation: Lessons from History and Recent Developments
research.description: Saez & Zucman (AEA Papers & Proceedings, 2022) distill European history to outline key enforcement features required for a successful 21st‑century wealth tax.

research.title: Avoidance Responses to the Wealth Tax
research.description: Mas‑Montserrat et al. (Journal of Public Economics, 2025) show Spain’s 2011 wealth‑tax reintroduction triggered significant avoidance that cut long‑run revenues by nearly three‑fold. :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}
